item.title: [SPR-862] Problem with ClassPathXmlApplicationContext using patterns for configLocations
item.description:
I am trying to use the ClassPathXmlApplicationContext to load up a bean config file using pattern matching as explained in 'PathMatchingResourcePatternResolver'. I have a test set up and have a 'resources' folder visible in my classpath but for some reason I cant seem to load this config file up. However if I supply the absolute file name it works fine.

I have tried many different varations of the configLocation ("-applicationContext.xml", "classpath:-applicationContext.xml",etc) but none seem to work either.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

Thanks.

Here is sample code:
//-------------------------------------------------
String[] configLocations = "classpath*:resources/*-applicationContext.xml"

ClassPathXmlApplicationContext context = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext(configLocations);

MyBean bean = (MyBean) context.getBean("myBean");

//---------------------------------------------------
item.summary: Problem with ClassPathXmlApplicationContext using patterns for configLocations

I actually got it to work doing the following...

I used this pattern string '**/*applicationContext.xml' and it was able to find it when running the test within Eclipse on my local machine however when I tried to deploy to Weblogic this did not work.

Also I am using Spring's EJB Support classes 'AbstractStatelessSessionBean' and I am defining in the ejb-jar.xml the env entries for 'ejb/BeanFactoryPath'. Should this pattern matching also work in this context? I read that this actually uses the ClassPathXmlApplicationContext behind the scenes to lookup the bean factory.

Thanks.

In ejb-jar.xml I name the context file usually without any prefixes (e.g. just "appconfig.xml"). When the file "appconfig.xml" resides in the root folder of the respective EJB-Jar everything works as expected.

For working within eclipse I usually add the folder which contains the configuration file to the classpath of my run-configuration.

Hope that helps,
Andreas

Thanks for the reply.

Everything works fine when not trying to use "patterns" (*/-someConfig). My question was if the Spring EJB support could handle patterns as well? I have it working fine using a static name such as "applicationContext.xml".

I finally got everything to work how I wanted it. I had to upgrade to Spring-1.1.5 Release for the 'classpath*:*/-context.xml' type pattern matching to work correctly.

Also I did not attempt to use pattern matchin within the EJB env-entries (ejb/BeanFactory). I just kept the file name static ex. 'applicationContext.xml' because I am using xdoclet and putting that in the xdoclet markup was causing compilation errors.

So it looks like this is fixed in Spring 1.1.5...

Juergen
